intro: Saussurea poophylla, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that helps it conserve moisture in harsh environments. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its root system is deep and robust, allowing it to access water from underground sources. Saussurea poophylla is adapted to extreme drought conditions and plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils in its native habitat.
